instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00291: What is 820-00291? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00291</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac webcam
threads.message: i have 2015 a1419 and the camera doesn't cut on. it also pulls down the <SIGNAL>5V_S0_CAMERA_F</SIGNAL> rail to 3.48v when it's connected. bad camera?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00291</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac webcam
threads.message: why does  "uvc camera <SIGNAL>VENDORID_1452</SIGNAL> <SIGNAL>PRODUCTID_34065</SIGNAL>" show up in the camera description even when the camera is disconnected

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00291</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac webcam
threads.message:
Replace L4202; tiny wire can bypass it.

Camera controller is on the MLB; not strange is always recognized.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00291</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac webcam
